definition: to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: The speaker declaimed against the government's new law.
sentences.chinese: 演说者攻击政府颁布的新法令。

sentences.english: Most people come to Toastmasters to overcome their fear of public speaking.
sentences.chinese: 许多人到宴会主持人之家来克服他们害怕演说的问题。

sentences.english: When it comes to public speaking, there are three major avenues you can take to make good money.
sentences.chinese: 在演说者方面，有三种方法可以使你挣得盆满钵满。

sentences.english: But there was another layer, designed for the people in the ministries.
sentences.chinese: 但演说还有另一层面，是说给部长和大臣们听的。

sentences.english: The plan did not work and the emphasis switched from stage set to soapbox.
sentences.chinese: 计划无法发挥功效，重点就从舞台转变为街头演说台。

sentences.english: And how do we balance that with the freedom of speech?
sentences.chinese: 以及我们如何权衡演说的自由度？

sentences.english: He was a motivational speaker, and vice president of a large company.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位富于鼓动性的演说家，一家大公司的副总裁。

sentences.english: I wonder what lay behind the president's speech.
sentences.chinese: 我不知总统的这篇演说用意何在。

sentences.english: That politician cries wolf in every speech he makes.
sentences.chinese: 那个政治家在他的每篇演说中都虚发警报。

sentences.english: His speech struck a perfect balance between humor and seriousness.
sentences.chinese: 他的演说把幽默性和严肃性的方寸掌握得恰到好处。

sentences.english: American presidents' inaugural addresses (APIA) represent the characteristics of the typical formal address.
sentences.chinese: 美国总统就职演说代表了正式演说的典型特点。

sentences.english: American presidents' inaugural addresses (APIA) represent the characteristics of the typical formal address.
sentences.chinese: 美国总统就职演说代表了正式演说的典型特点。

sentences.english: The speeches also dealt with the international situation and America’s place in the world.
sentences.chinese: 这些演说也涉及到国际形势和美国在世界上的地位。

sentences.english: The candidate delivers countless speeches and shakes countless hands.
sentences.chinese: 他们发表数不清的演说，同数不清的人握手。

sentences.english: The speaker incited the mob to demonstrate against the rising cost of living.
sentences.chinese: 演说者鼓动群众示威游行，抗议生活费高涨。

sentences.english: But fewer than one in three American households with televisions tuned in to the speech.
sentences.chinese: 但是只有不足三分之一的美国家庭在收看他的演说。

definition: (of a singer etc) excellent in voice and expression (idiom)
to make a speech/to make some remarks
to complete a draft/to put out a manuscript
to rise to power (in politics)/to go on stage (in the theater)
prologue of play/opening remarks/preamble (of speeches, articles etc)
